intro: Grevillea linearis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed waratah, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its long, narrow leaves and striking red or orange flowers that bloom in winter. The plant is part of the Proteaceae family and is well adapted to dry, sandy soils. It thrives in full sun and is often found in coastal regions. Grevillea linearis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is commonly cultivated in gardens.
